intro: Stenia luerorum, commonly known as the Luer's stenia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in shaded forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and less-studied species within its family.
